required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on December 16, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Effects of Training Intensity on Physical Fitness and Body Composition in Cystic Fibrosis
clinical_study.official_title: Effects of Endurance Training Intensity on Exercise Capacity, Body Composition, and Appetite Regulation in Cystic Fibrosis

collaborator.agency: University of Kiel, Arbeitsbereich Sportmedizin und Trainingswissenschaften

brief_summary.textblock: Aim of the randomized controlled trial is to investigate the effects of endurance training with different intensities on physical performance, body composition and appetite regulation in people with cystic fibrosis.

primary_outcome.time_frame: at baseline and after 4 weeks of exercise training program
primary_outcome.description: measured with peak Oxygen uptake (VO2) in percent predicted

primary_outcome.time_frame: at baseline and after 4 weeks of exercise training program
primary_outcome.description: measured with peak Workload in percent predicted

primary_outcome.time_frame: at baseline and after 4 weeks of exercise training program
primary_outcome.description: measured with body fat mass index (FMI) in kg / m*2

primary_outcome.measure: change in Body fat free mass index
primary_outcome.time_frame: at baseline and after 4 weeks of exercise training program
primary_outcome.description: measured with fat free body mass index (FFMI) in kg / m*2

secondary_outcome.measure: change in Forced Expiratory Volume in 1 second
secondary_outcome.time_frame: at baseline and after 4 weeks of exercise training program
secondary_outcome.description: measured with Forced Expiratory Volume in 1 second (FEV1) in percent predicted

secondary_outcome.measure: change in Health related quality of life
secondary_outcome.time_frame: at baseline and six and twelve months after completion of exercise training program
secondary_outcome.description: measured with the Cystic Fibrosis Questionnaire Revised (CFQ-R); 9 Quality of life domains: Physical, role/school, vitality, emotion, social, body image, eating, treatment burden, health perceptions: 3 symptom scales: Weight, respiratory, and digestion Scores range from 0 to 100, with higher scores indicating better health.

secondary_outcome.measure: appetite control - subjective feeling of hunger
secondary_outcome.time_frame: at baseline and after 4 weeks of exercise training program
secondary_outcome.description: measured with visual analogue scales. The scale consists of a 10 cm vertical line anchored with "not hungry at all" at the left side and with "extremely hungry" at the right side.

arm_group.description: Exercise training with intermittent bouts of high intensity

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- confirmed diagnosis of cystic fibrosis by at least 2 sweat tests and / or by the presence of two CF mutations,
- willingness to participate in and to comply with the research project procedure,
- written informed consent of patients,
- age ≥ 18 years,
- FEV1 of pred. ≥ 40%,
- Stable condition (as indicated by absence of one or more signs: new or increased haemoptysis, increased malaise, fatigue or lethargy, temperature over 38°C, weight loss, sinus pain and a decrease in pulmonary function by 10% or more)
Exclusion Criteria:
- Severe pulmonary exacerbation,
- cor pulmonale,
- musculoskeletal discomfort that makes a regular exercise training impossible,
- untreated CF-related diabetes,
- multidrug resistance organism: Multi-resistant gram-negative bacteria (MRGNB); methicillin-resistant Staphylococcus aureus (MRSA)

overall_official.affiliation: Insitute of Human Nutrition, University of Kiel
